active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group debate, argue which stage of the threat intelligence lifecycle (Planning & Direction, Collection, Processing, Analysis & Production, Dissemination, Feedback) is most critical for preventing ransomware attacks. Defend your position with real-world examples from NIST SP 800-150, such as structured sharing of IoCs and TTPs.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence Lifecycle Management (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > Incident 002_Detection and Analysis > 005_Threat Intelligence Integration > Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP) > 003_Threat Intelligence Lifecycle Management). **Comprehensive Content (Web-Grounded Research, Completed per Voter Consensus):** Threat Intelligence Lifecycle: Structured process (Planning & Direction: set intel requirements; Collection: gather raw data from feeds/OSINT; Processing/Exploitation: filter, normalize, enrich (e.g., IoC validation); Analysis & Production: contextualize into reports (TTPs, actor attribution); Dissemination: share via STIX/TAXII; Feedback: measure impact, refine). Integrates with TIPs like MISP (automated collection/processing/sharing). Core Concepts: Cyber Threat Information (NIST SP 800-150); IoCs (evidence like IPs/hashes, RFC 9424: STIX 2.1/TAXII 2.1 for CTI sharing/exchange, enabling automated TIP interoperability); TTPs (MITRE ATT&CK). NIST CSF 2.0/SP 800-61 Rev. 3: Integrate intel into IR risk management. RFC 9424 (full): Defines STIX 2.1 objects (e.g., Indicators, Reports) and TAXII 2.1 channels for secure, scalable CTI exchange in TIPs. **Sources:** NIST SP 800-150 (csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/150), NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 3 (csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/61/r3), RFC 9424 (datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9424), MITRE ATT&CK (attack.mitre.org), MISP Project (misp-project.org). **Pedagogy Integration:** Use provided Learning Objectives (span Bloom's: Remember to Create). Scaffolding: Generate flashcards progressively across 4 layers (Foundation → Components → Implementation → Integration). Active Learning: Embed scenario-based cards from discussion/problem-solving exercises. Prerequisites: Link to IR basics (NIST SP 800-61). Concept Map: Flashcards reference 'Lifecycle hub → stage spokes → TIP/feedback links'. **Generate Flashcards:** Strictly follow Flashcard Schema. Output ONLY a JSON array of objects, e.g., [{'type': 'mcq', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': 'APPLY', 'scaffolding_layer': 3, 'hierarchy_tag': 'Level 6'}]. Ensure high-quality: measurable, active recall, distractors plausible, explanations tie to standards/TIPs/real-world (e.g., ransomware via NIST). Balance coverage: All objectives/layers. Voter-approved: 82.9% consensus.
